name: Area_Int
CHAL1_ans: pave the driveway (protect against 120 heavy rainfall events over 30 years)
CHAL1_txt: Initial cost is high, but give the most logical protection for the longest time frame
CHAL2_txt: I based my decision on price.  10 yrs of insurance would cost $57,600  and you could easily put away 1/2 that much and have enough with interest to cover the cost if anything does happen.  If it has not happened in 10 yrs., I would take the chance.  also I think changes to the property could help prevent flooding.

CHAL2_txt: The description said that 1.9 inches of rainfall in a day caused the prvious homeowner $25,000 in damages. The graph shows that for the current period (2020-2049), average rainfall will exceed 1.9 inches, making purchasing an insurance policy the most cost-effective option on average (according to the model).
